alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 11:40PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN PINE...SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS...WASHBURN...EASTERN BURNETT AND SOUTHWESTERN SAWYER COUNTIES... At 1140 PM CST, heavy snow showers were along a line extending from near Willow River, to 6 miles north of Duxbury, to 6 miles southeast of Dairyland, to near Minong, and moving southeast at 40 mph. Visibilities of 1/2 mile or less, wind gusts up to 35 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with these heavy snow showers. These heavy snow showers will be near... Minong, Bruno, and Cloverton around 1145 PM CST. Duxbury around 1150 PM CST. Trego, Webb Lake Wisconsin, and Mille Lacs Band Lena Lake Area around 1155 PM CST. Danbury around 1200 AM CST. Stone Lake around 1210 AM CST. Spooner and Saint Croix State Park around 1215 AM CST. Birchwood and Saint Croix Band Sand Lake Area around 1225 AM CST. Shell Lake, Webster, and Hertel around 1230 AM CST. Be prepared for changing visibility and road conditions. Reduce your speed and allow more space between you and the vehicle in front of you.
